articles.title: Congratulations to President of Azerbaijan
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Azerbaijan
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Ilham Aliyev on his reelection as President of Azerbaijan. 
					 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished the president greater success in his noble work for the development and prosperity of his country.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Namibian Foreign Ministers Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Namibian Foreign Ministers Held
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and Namibian Foreign Minister Marco Hausiku at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 Present there were officials concerned from the DPRK side and the members of the Namibian government delegation from the Namibian side.
					
					 At the talks the two sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Namibia and on matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Personal Message to Kim Jong Il from Namibian President
articles.content:
Personal Message to Kim Jong Il from Namibian President
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a personal message from Namibian President Hifikepunye Pohamba.
					 It was handed to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun today by Namibian Foreign Minister Marco Hausiku on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Namibian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Namibian Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Namibian Foreign Minister Marco Hausiku on a visit to the DPRK.
					 It was handed to DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun by the Namibian foreign minister Tuesday.

articles.title: Namibian Government Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Namibian Government Delegation Feted
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government arranged a reception at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday in honor of the Namibian government delegation on a visit to the DPRK.
					Present there on invitation were members of the delegation headed by Foreign Minister Marco Hausiku.
					
					Present there were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun and officials concerned.
					
					Pak Ui Chun in a speech said that the delegation's visit to the DPRK shows the desire and will of the Namibian government and people to boost the bilateral relations.
					
					The friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and Sam Nujoma have grown stronger under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and President Hifikepunye Pohamba, he stressed.
					
					He wished the government and people of Namibia greater success in their work for consolidating the national independence, developing economy and achieving social progress.
					
					Marco Hausiku in a speech said that it is their duty to develop the friendly relations between Namibia and the DPRK provided by Sam Nujoma and Kim Il Sung.
					
					The bilateral relations are developing on good terms as the days go by thanks to the leaders of the two countries, he noted, expressing his resolution to make positive efforts to consolidate and boost the good friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Lao Party Delegation Here
articles.content:
Lao Party Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government, arrived here today.
					 It was met at the airport by Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, Lao ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK and LPRP Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK and LPRP Held
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) were held here today.
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, officials concerned from the DPRK side and members of the LPRP delegation headed by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the LPRP who is vice-prime minister and foreign minister of Laos, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, Laotian ambassador to the DPRK, from the Lao side.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of activities of their parties and discussed the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and exchanged views on matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Delegation of LPRP
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Delegation of LPRP
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party. 
					 It was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Tuesday by head of the delegation Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government.

articles.title: Inter-Governmental Agreement on Air Service between DPRK and Kuwait Signed
articles.content:
Inter-Governmental Agreement on Air Service between DPRK and Kuwait Signed
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- An inter-governmental agreement on air service between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and Kuwait was signed in Kuwait on Oct. 15.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Ho Jong, DPRK ambassador to Kuwait, and staff members of his embassy and an official of the General Bureau of Civil Aviation of the DPRK and Fawaz Abdul Aziz Al-Farah, chairman of the General Council of the Civil Aviation of Kuwait, and officials concerned.
					
					 An agreement was inked by the DPRK ambassador and the chairman of the above-mentioned general council.

articles.title: End to U.S. Nuclear Threat to DPRK Called for
articles.content:
End to U.S. Nuclear Threat to DPRK Called for
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) --The U.S. nuclear threat to the DPRK should be ended and the former's hostile policy toward the latter be withdrawn definitely if the Korean Peninsula is to be denuclearized, said a DPRK delegate in a speech at the meeting of the First Committee of the 63rd UN General Assembly on Oct. 13.
					Noting that the situation in Northeast Asia centering around the Korean Peninsula still remains tense, he recalled that there are ceaseless developments that arouse concern as evidenced by the undisguised large-scale joint military exercises aimed at mounting a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK being staged behind the scene of dialogue and the moves taking place to integrate the U.S.-Japan military alliance and the U.S.-south Korea military alliance.
					
					 He went on:
					
					The option taken by the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrent was attributable to the U.S. deep-rooted hostile policy and its policy of nuclear threat to the DPRK that have persisted for more than half a century.
					
					Referring to the steadfast stand and sincere efforts of the DPRK government to seek a peaceful negotiated settlement of the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula, he said:
					
					In order to ensure sustainable peace and security of the world, it is necessary, first of all, to totally eliminate all the nuclear weapons from the earth.
					
					The high-handed nuclear policy based on double standards is the main factor of reducing the disarmament conventions including NPT to dead ones devoid of binding force and driving the world to a nuclear arms race.
					
					It is entirely thanks to the DPRK's independent politics and Songun politics that a war is averted and peace is preserved on the peninsula and the region at present.
					
					The DPRK will in the future, too, make persevering efforts to ensure peace and security there.

articles.title: National Day of Czech Republic Marked
articles.content:
National Day of Czech Republic Marked
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition "History of Czech Beer" was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cultural Centre today on the occasion of the 90th national day of the Czech Republic. 
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ryu Sung Rim, chairman of the DPRK-Czech Friendship Association, and officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang and Czech Ambassador to the DPRK Martin Tomco and staff members of his embassy.
					
					Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and staff members of different embassies here. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony. 
					
					Noting that the DPRK-Czech friendly relations have a long history, speakers expressed belief that this exhibition would contribute to the development of the cultural relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Pyongyang in Autumn Full of National Flavor
articles.content:
Pyongyang in Autumn Full of National Flavor
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Nowadays the streets of Pyongyang are presenting peculiar autumn scenes full of national flavor.
					Roast chestnut and sweat potato stalls in different spots of the city started their services all at once, giving off tasty odor of roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes.
					
					The stalls found everywhere of the streets are always crowded with customers buying delicious roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes.
					
					Kim Ok Sun who has served long in public catering from her maidenhood told KCNA that the odor of roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes is a flavor peculiar to the Korean nation. She further said:
					
					Roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes are famous as an ancestral specialty of Pyongyang along with the Pyongyang cold noodle and Pyongyang onban (rice put in hot soup).
					
					President Kim Il Sung, who treasured the national customs, instructed officials to take measures so that the Pyongyang citizens could buy   roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes in autumn, saying that should be the autumn scene of Pyongyang. He designated the supplying bases of sweat potatoes and acquainted himself with the area of chestnut forests in the country, giving instructions to establish a rational system of their management.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, true to the lofty idea of the President, took care that a large amount of sweat potatoes and chestnuts were supplied to the city every year and personally saw a chestnut roaster and even cracked roast chestnuts.
					
					The odor of roast chestnuts and sweat potatoes fills the air of the streets of the city every year, conveying his warm love for the people.

articles.title: Japan Not Qualified to Participate in Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
Japan Not Qualified to Participate in Six-Party Talks
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Senior government officials of Japan including the prime minister, the chief cabinet secretary and the foreign minister are blustering "they can never lift sanctions against North Korea," asserting that Japan would discuss the issue of liquidating Japan's past after the settlement of the "abduction" issue. Minju Joson Tuesday in a signed commentary carried in this regard observes:
					The "abduction" issue much advertised by Japan as "cure-all" has been discussed between the DPRK and Japan so far and it has already become clear thanks to the sincere efforts of the DPRK. 
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are driving the DPRK-Japan relations to an extremely tense phase and working hard to torpedo the six-party talks, shelving the issue of settling Japan's past crimes and hyping the "abduction" issue, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					The row kicked up by the Japanese reactionaries over the "abduction" issue is a reckless act of carrying the hostile relations between the DPRK and Japan into extremes and little short of committing a double or treble crime in addition to those crimes perpetrated by Japan in the past. 
					
					The servicepersons and people of the DPRK feel irrepressible resentment at the mean actions of the Japanese authorities to attain a sinister political aim under the pretext of the "abduction" issue and harden their will to settle accounts with the Japanese reactionaries at any cost.
					
					It is our view that Japan has already lost the qualification to participate in the six-party talks as it has obstructed the talks so far. In particular, Japan is making desperate efforts to dodge the fulfillment of the commitment on which an agreement was reached among the six parties. This compels us to think if Japan is allowed to participate in the talks, it will create complexities in the way of settling the issue and the talks turn into mayhem and raise a question as to whether there is any need to have the six-party talks attended by Japan. It is the view of the DPRK that now is the time to have an exhaustive discussion on the qualification of Japan to participate in the talks as it has persistently stood in their way even after being branded as a disturber of the six-party talks. It is quite natural to deprive the Japanese reactionaries of the qualification to participate in the said talks as they are unilaterally sticking to the stand not to honor Japan's commitment at a time when actions are being taken to implement the commitments the six parties promised to fulfill before the world.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Psychological Campaign under Fire
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Psychological Campaign under Fire
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- Ultra-right conservative organizations of south Korea are getting evermore undisguised in scattering anti-DPRK leaflets. This is attributable to the Lee Myung Bak group which is conniving and patronizing their moves. Herein lies the gravity of the issue.
					Minju Joson today says this in a signed commentary.
					
					It goes on:
					
					As disclosed, it was none other than the Lee group that cooked up ultra-right conservative organizations such as the "Association of  the Movement for Free North Korea" taking the lead in scattering those leaflets. Traitor Lee Myung Bak, defaming the June 15 era which paved a wide avenue for independent reunification, peace and prosperity as a "lost decade," laid it down as a policy to make up for it, prompted by sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with fellow countrymen. Consequently, ultra-right conservatives who are hell bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen after holding key posts in the regime knocked into shape many ultra-right conservative organizations under the mask of "civilian." These reptile organizations are busy everyday scattering anti-DPRK leaflets not only into the Kaesong Industrial Zone and the area of Mt. Kumgang resort but also into vast areas of South and North Hwanghae provinces and Kangwon Province along the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					As seen above, the psychological warfare launched by the ultra-right conservative organizations against the army and people of the DPRK at the prodding of the Lee group is now gaining in scope and strength.
					
					It is as foolish an act as running one's head to a wall to try to bring down the socialist system in the DPRK through the above-said psychological campaign.
					
					What matters is that such scattering of anti-DPRK leaflets may entail very grave consequences. As the Lee group is conniving at and patronizing the ultra-right conservative organizations' mean psychological campaign getting on the nerves of the army and people of the DPRK, any accidental case in any area along the MDL may trigger off an armed conflict. It is beyond any doubt that this conflict will develop into a new war, a nuclear war because the U.S. massively stockpiled nuclear weapons in south Korea and all Koreans in the north and the south will suffer from it. It is crystal clear that in that case the Lee group will not be safe, either. In the final analysis, the Lee group is digging its own grave.
					
					Lee has so far committed too hideous crimes against the nation to escape a stern judgment of history. He had better bear this in mind and immediately stop the suicidal move to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen, warns the commentary.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontational Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontational Policy
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is now persistently pursuing its criminal confrontation with the north, refusing to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration quite contrary to the trend of the times and the aspiration of the nation. This crime comes under fire by a signed commentary of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday.
					Traitor Lee Myung Bak is scaling the inter-Korean relations on the basis of the nuclear issue and, accordingly, persistently pursuing anti-DPRK confrontational policy, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					This is a clear revelation of the traitorous clique's anachronistic conception of confrontation as they blindly follow the outside forces' hostile policy towards the DPRK and regard fellow countrymen as the object to be stifled, not away with the way of thinking dating back to the era of Cold War. 
					
					As known to everybody, the patriotic movement for reunification of different social standings in south Korea which made dynamic progress under the banner of "By our nation itself" reflected the desire and wishes of the nation and the need of the June 15 era of reunification which has advanced thanks to them. It has nothing in common with any "plot of pro-north leftist forces."
					
					What is more intolerable is the fact that the Lee group revealed its reckless intention to bring down even the system in the north,  talking about "contingency" obsessed with the daydream of achieving "unification through absorption of the north." It is an unpardonable blatant challenge and open declaration of a war against the north that the group of traitors has gone so reckless as to disclose its ambition for invading the north, daringly defaming the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					
					The north does not slight any issue of the north-south relations. But, the Lee group should know that the north can never treat the group with leniency as it goes mad with confrontation with the north, even harboring a wild ambition. 
					
					The north will never remain a passive onlooker to its anti-DPRK confrontational racket but will decisively and mercilessly counter without the slightest tolerance any action to hurt the inviolable system in the north, the dignity and life and soul of the people in the north.
					
					The Lee group will only face severe punishment by history and the nation if it persistently pursues confrontation with the north, seized by the wrong concept of confrontation with fellow countrymen in disregard of the need of the June 15 era of reunification and the aspiration of the nation.
					
					Lee would be well advised to drop his foolish idea of confrontation and behave himself.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Tradition of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Tradition of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea and the army and people of the DPRK are sure to emerge successful in their march in the new century as they regard the revolutionary tradition of Mt. Paektu established by President Kim Il Sung as the eternal treasured sword, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The mental power which the WPK regards as the most powerful driving force for building a great prosperous powerful nation is rooted in the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu and the validity of the guidelines and principle maintained by it in its march in the new century has been proved in the course of the long-drawn revolution which originated from the "Down-with-Imperialism Union".
					
					 The WPK found the key to the victory in the cause of building a great prosperous powerful nation in the new century in inheriting the revolutionary tradition in all fields and made sure that utmost efforts were made to this end. This was a wise measure taken, foreseeing the prospect of the revolution.
					
					 The successful inheritance of the revolutionary tradition of Mt. Paektu helped invariably adhere to the idea and principle which have been maintained by the Korean revolution throughout its history in the 21st century, too, consolidate the revolutionary ranks in the DPRK as required by the new century and usher in a period of fresh surge in the building of a great prosperous powerful nation.
					
					 The third and fourth generations of the revolution acting a main force of the revolutionary ranks have always lived and struggled like the revolutionary forerunners, regarding the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas as a model and a textbook in life.
					
					 The country is now witnessing such stirring realities as those in the postwar period in which the whole party and army and all people made a leap forward to build a socialist power, in hearty response to the call of the Party. The revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu and the Kanggye spirit, a continuation of the Chollima spirit, are prevailing in the society and it is alive with the same militant fighting spirit as that pervaded in the anti-Japanese ranks. The formula of the Korean revolution remains unchanged as it weathers out stern trials with the revolutionary tradition as a weapon and brings about a turning phase in socialist construction, regarding this tradition as guidelines.
					
					 The historic experience gained by the Korean revolution goes to prove that the Songun principle should be strictly applied to the revolution and the construction in order to successfully carry forward the revolutionary tradition of the Party.
					
					  The army and people in the DPRK will firmly defend and carry forward and develop the revolutionary tradition of Juche and the revolutionary tradition of Mt. Paektu and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started from the "Down-with-Imperialism Union", remaining true to the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il no matter what storm and stress they may face in their way.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about Criminals Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about Criminals Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Peasants Associations and the Federation of Women Peasants Associations of south Korea held a joint press conference in Seoul on Oct. 17 demanding a thorough probe into the truth about the criminals engrossed in irregularities and corruption, according to the south Korean CBS.
					Speakers at the press conference referred to the fact that high-ranking "government" officials' illegal expropriation of subsidies to rice cultivators was disclosed recently to stir up public furor.
					
					They accused those earning money through the purchase of land of taking away even subsidies to rice cultivators.
					
					They strongly urged the "government" to make a thorough probe into the above-said criminals and punish them.
					
					Prior to the press conference, members of the two organizations conducted information service for citizens.

articles.title: WPK Praised
articles.content:
WPK Praised
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea founded by President Kim Il Sung and led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il has firmly upheld the red flag and steadily advanced along the road of socialism, the ideal of humankind, said   Oleg Shenin, chairman of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, addressing a meeting held in Russia on Oct. 6 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the WPK.
					The WPK is the only party in the world which has led the state and its people along the road of victory, fully responsible for their destiny, he added. 
					
					Vladimir Veredin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, in a speech made at the meeting, noted that over the past more than six decades the WPK has demonstrated its victory and glory because the whole people are united around it as firm as a rock. 
					
					The single-minded unity of the DPRK where the whole party and army and all people are united close as one in the monolithic idea and purpose serves as the most powerful weapon in the world, he stressed.

articles.title: Puppet Ministry of Justice's Distortion of Human Rights Abuses Blasted
articles.content:
Puppet Ministry of Justice's Distortion of Human Rights Abuses Blasted
Pyongyang, October 21 (KCNA) -- The People's Measure Council against the Total Opening of south Korean Market to American Beef issued a statement on Oct. 17 denouncing the puppet Ministry of Justice for submitting to the UN Human Rights Council a document peppered with sheer lies, denying the human rights abuses perpetrated by the riot police during its crackdown upon candlelight rallies. 
					The statement pointed to the fact that in the above-said document the authorities falsified truth by asserting that the assertion made about human rights abuses is based on wrong information and the "government" is protecting the freedom of expression, peaceful assembly and demonstration.
					
					The statement disclosed the facts that the fascist police mobilized to suppress candlelight actions indiscriminately walked off their participants and, not content with this, mercilessly assaulted and arrested even those who were watching human rights abuses on the scene and even infringed upon the rights of women arrestees.
					
					The statement urged the "government" to retract the false document presented to the UN Human Rights Council and immediately fire the chief responsible for this. 
					
					It also demanded the minister of Justice step down as he has refused to take a legal action against the police hooligans.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun departe con su homologo namibio
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun departe con su homologo namibio
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 21 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, y su homologo de la Republica de Namibia, Marco Hausiku. 
					Estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los funcionarios correspondientes y por la namibia los miembros de la delegacion gubernamental. 
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros temas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe carta personal del presidente namibio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe carta personal del presidente namibio
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio la carta personal que le enviara el presidente de la Republica de Namibia, Hifikepunye Pohamba.
					El canciller namibio, Marco Hausiku, de visita en Corea, la entrego este martes a su homologo coreano Pak Ui Chun.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y PPRL
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y PPRL
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar este martes en esta capital las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao.
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana el secretario Choe Thae Bok y el subjefe de departamento Kim Thae Jong, del CC del PTC, y otros funcionarios y, por la laosiana, los miembros de la delegacion del PPRL presidida por el miembro de Buro Politico del Comite Central del partido y presidente de la Comision de Relaciones Exteriores, vicepremier y canciller del gobierno, Thongloun Sisoulith y el embajador lao en Corea Chaleune Warinthrasak.
					
					Ambas partes informaron de las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Rubricado acuerdo sobre aerolinea entre Corea y Kuwait
articles.content:
Rubricado acuerdo sobre aerolinea entre Corea y Kuwait
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 15 en Kuwait el acuerdo sobre la aerovia entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del Estado de Kuwait.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el embajador Ho Jong y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana en ese pais y un funcionario de la Direccion General de Aviacion Civil de Corea y, por la de Kuwait, el presidente del Consejo General de Aviacion Civil, Fawaz Abdul Aziz Al-Farah, y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ho Jong y Fawaz Abdul Aziz Al-Farah suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia guerra psicologica anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia guerra psicologica anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- La gravedad del lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC por parte de las entidades conservadoras ultraderechistas del Sur de Corea esta en que esta campana se torna cada vez mas intensa bajo el amparo de la banda de Lee Myung Bak. 
					Revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este martes y continua:
					
					Como se ha revelado, la banda de Lee Myung Bak constituyo las entidades conservadoras ultraderechistas como la "Asociacion de movimiento por libre Norte de Corea", que toman la delantera en el lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC.
					
					El traidor Lee presento como su politica el servilismo a EE.UU. y la confrontacion fratricida insultando como "10 anos perdidos" la epoca del 15 de Junio, que allano el ancho camino de la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad. 
					
					Por consiguiente, los elementos conservadores ultraderechistas fanaticos por la confrontacion fratricida ocuparon cargos importantes del poder y aparecieron numerosas entidades de igual indole disfrazadas de "civiles".
					
					Estas entidades pagadas lanzan casi todos los dias volantes anti-RPDC no solo en la zona industrial de Kaesong y la zona turistica del monte Kumgang sino tambien en las extensas areas de las provincias limitrofes con la Linea de Demarcacion Militar como las de Kangwon y de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte.
					
					Esta guerra psicologica contra el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea se amplia y se intensifica cada dia mas por la instigacion de la horda de Lee Myung Bak.
					
					El intento de destruir el socialismo de la RPDC con unos volantes es una tonteria igual a tratar de quebrar una pena con huevos.
					
					Lo problematico es que el esparcimiento de volantes puede tener graves consecuencias. 
					
					Dado que esta sucia campana es tolerada y protegida por la banda de Lee Myung Bak, cualquier contingencia en la zona de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar puede convertirse en un choque armado.
					
					Ya que EE.UU. emplazo en suelo surcoreano incontables armas nucleares, ese conflicto armado dara paso a una nueva guerra nuclear, de la cual serian victimas todos los coreanos del Norte y el Sur.
					
					Cuando esto suceda, no podra salir ilesa ni la banda de Lee.
					
					En fin de cuentas, esta horda esta cavando la sepultura de si misma. 
					
					Los crimenes cometidos hasta ahora contra la nacion bastan para que el traidor Lee fuera sentenciado duro por la historia. 
					
					Lee debe saberlo y dejar de inmediato sus maniobras fratricidas que lo llevaran a la autodestruccion.

articles.title: Minju Joson cuestiona la presencia de Japon en la cita a 6 bandas
articles.content:
Minju Joson cuestiona la presencia de Japon en la cita a 6 bandas
Pyongyang, 21 de octubre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro, el director del secretariado del gabinete, el canciller y otros ministros del gobierno japones dicen que no pueden levantar jamas la sancion contra el Norte de Corea insistiendo en que discutirian el problema de liquidacion del pasado criminal despues de resuelto el del "secuestro".
					 El problema del "secuestro", que Japon utiliza como su "panacea", fue abordado hasta ahora entre este pais isleno y la RPDC y esclarecido gracias a los esfuerzos sinceros de la segunda.
					
					 Destaca el rotativo Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este martes y prosigue:
					
					 Ahora los reaccionarios japoneses propagan de modo exagerado el problema del "secuestro" silenciando el de liquidacion de su pasado criminal a fin de exacerbar al extremo las relaciones coreana-japonesas y llevar al fracaso las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					 El alboroto de "secuestro" es una locura que lleva al extremo las relaciones hostiles Corea-Japon y doble y triple crimen que abulta el expediente criminal del pasado del pais isleno. 
					
					 Ahora el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea redoblan su determinacion de ajustar la cuenta, cueste lo que cueste, muy indignados por las sucias maniobras de las autoridades japonesas que persiguen su malsano objetivo politico so pretexto del problema del "secuestro".
					
					 Puesto que Japon perdio la calidad de participante en la cita a 6 partes por haberla estropeado hasta ahora y, en particular, se obstina en no cumplir su deber acordado entre las 6 partes, la RPDC se ve obligada a meditar en la necesidad de este dialogo con la presencia de Japon.
					
					 Es que la presencia de la delegacion japonesa complicara la solucion del problema y convertira la mesa del dialogo en un lugar tumultuoso.
					
					 La RPDC opina que llego el tiempo de debatir sinceramente sobre la calificacion de Japon de participar en la cita a 6 bandas. 
					
					 Es muy natural que se les privara a los reaccionarios japoneses el derecho a participar porque ellos rehusan el cumplimiento de su deber justamente cuando los demas participantes se decidieron a cumplir sus compromisos anunciados a la vista del mundo.
